full_text:
Incident Briefing (ICS 201)
1. Incident Name: 2. Incident Number: 3. Date/Time Initiated:
Emerald City Flood Date: 8-4-20XX Time: 1000
4. Map/Sketch (include sketch, showing the total area of operations, the incident site/area, impacted and threatened
areas, overflight results, trajectories, impacted shorelines, or other graphics depicting situational status and resource
assignment):
5. Situation Summary and Health and Safety Briefing (for briefings or transfer of command): Recognize potential
incident Health and Safety Hazards and develop necessary measures (remove hazard, provide personal protective
equipment, warn people of the hazard) to protect responders from those hazards.
Watch for out water increasing water levels
Moving vehicles may move not observe traffic controls
6. Prepared by: Name: Ralph Wilkins Position/Title: IC Signature: Ralph Wilkins
ICS 201, Page 1 Date/Time: 8-4-20XX 1000 hours
ICS Forms
Booklet


INCIDENT BRIEFING (ICS 201)
1. Incident Name: 2. Incident Number: 3. Date/Time Initiated:
Date: 8-4-20XX Time: 1000
7. Current and Planned Objectives:
▪ Addressing safety of affected residents through warning, evacuation, and sheltering.
▪ Monitoring critical infrastructure.
▪ Releasing accurate public information.
▪ Provide basic services to the public as best as possible.
8. Current and Planned Actions, Strategies, and Tactics:
Time: Actions:
The County Emergency Management Office has activated the Emergency Operations Center (EOC).
0800
The Incident Command Post (ICP), located at Fire Station #1 at Avenue F and 6th Street, requested an
0815
All-Hazard Incident Management Team (IMT) from the State
Notification received from the National Weather Service the flooding is expected to crest at 1800 today.
0820
It is expected that this flood crest will cause flooding as indicated on the projected floodplain map.
0825 The Staging Area was established at Avenue I and 12th Street
The EOC has contacted the school bus service for buses and requested that the American Red Cross
0830
open a shelter for evacuees.
The EOC has activated the local emergency notification system announcing the evacuation to the
0830
affected area
Residents in the area north of the Tenth Street Bridge from Main Street on the east to Avenue A on the
0830
west are being asked to evacuate their homes. This evacuation area extends north to 19th Street.
0900 The Department of Public Works has begun sandbagging and continues to monitor river levels
The Incident Commander orders a full Command Staff and General Staff are required by the next
0900
operations period beginning at 1800. The State IMT Notified.
Business owners in the industrial park are being contacted by the Fire Department to determine if any
0912
of their stored chemicals will be affected by the flooding.
Police vehicles are patrolling the evacuation area announcing the evacuation via PA systems and
0920
staffing traffic patrol points.
6. Prepared by: Name: Ralph Wilkins Position/Title: IC Signature: Ralph Wilkins
ICS 201, Page 2 Date/Time: 8-4-20XX 1000

Emerald Flood Date: 8-4-20XX Time: 1000
9. Current Organization (fill in additional organization as appropriate):

Safety Officer
Lt. Carl Miller
Operations

River Level Monitor Evacuation Group Sandbagging Group Shelter Group
Group Brown Williams Unstaffed

ICS 201, Page 3 Date/Time: 8-4-20XX 1000
